fields.name: action
fields.comment: The data access action taken by the user.

fields.name: app
fields.comment: he system, service, or application that generated the data access event. Examples include Onedrive, Sharepoint, drive, AzureActiveDirectory.

fields.name: application_id
fields.comment: Application ID of the user

fields.name: object
fields.comment: Resource object name on which the action was performed by a user.

fields.name: object_attrs
fields.comment: The attributes that were updated on the updated resource object, if applicable.

fields.name: object_category
fields.comment: Generic name for the class of the updated resource object. Expected values may be specific to an app.

fields.name: object_id
fields.comment: The unique updated resource object ID as presented to the system, if applicable. For example, a source_folder_id, doc_id.

fields.name: object_path
fields.comment: The path of the modified resource object, if applicable, such as a file, directory, or volume.

fields.name: object_size
fields.comment: The size of the modified resource object.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The destination where the data resides or where it is being accessed, such as the product or application. You can alias this from more specific fields not included in this data model, such as dest_host, dest_ip, dest_url or dest_name.

fields.name: dest_name
fields.comment: Name of the destination as defined by the Vendor.

fields.name: dest_type
fields.comment: The type of the destination object, such as 'instance', 'storage', 'firewall', 'printer'.

fields.name: dest_url
fields.comment: Url of the product, application or object.

fields.name: dvc
fields.comment: The device that reported the data access event.

fields.name: email
fields.comment: The email address of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event.

fields.name: owner
fields.comment: Resource owner.

fields.name: owner_id
fields.comment: ID of the owner as defined by the vendor.

fields.name: owner_email
fields.comment: Email of the resource owner.

fields.name: parent_object
fields.comment: Parent of the object name on which the action was performed by a user.

fields.name: parent_object_category
fields.comment: Object category of the parent object on which action was performed by a user.

fields.name: parent_object_id
fields.comment: Object id of the parent object on which the action was performed by a user.

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: A human-readable signature name.

fields.name: signature_id
fields.comment: The unique identifier or event code of the event signature.

fields.name: src
fields.comment: The endpoint client host.

fields.name: user_agent
fields.comment: The user agent through which the request was made, such as Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) or aws-cli/2.0.0 Python/3.7.4 Darwin/18.7.0 botocore/2.0.0dev4.

fields.name: user_email
fields.comment: The email address of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event.

fields.name: user_group
fields.comment: The group of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event.

fields.name: user_id
fields.comment: The unique id of the user involved in the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: user_name
fields.comment: The user name of the user or entity performing the change. For account changes, this is the account that was changed (see src_user_name for user or entity performing the change)

fields.name: user_role
fields.comment: The role of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event.

fields.name: user_type
fields.comment: The type of the user involved in the event or who initiated the event, such as IAMUser, Admin, or System. For account management events, this should represent the type of the user changed by the request.

fields.name: vendor_account
fields.comment: The account that manages the user that initiated the request.

fields.name: vendor_product_id
fields.comment: The vendor and product name ID as defined by the vendor.

fields.name: vendor_region
fields.comment: The data center region where the change occurred, such as us-west-2.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user involved in the event, or who initiated the event.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product name of the vendor.
